description: Constitutional Accountability Center President Elizabeth Wydra weighs in on the second strike by the United States of an alleged drug boat while survivors were in the water and states these events raise serious legal questions. Elizabeth talks about the law of naval warfare & the law of armed conflict and how this act might be considered a war crime, & that there could be legal consequences for Secretary Hegseth. She also talks about when she expects to hear from the US Supreme Court on their ruling over the President's tariff actions. Elizabeth speaks with Joe Mathieu and Amara Omeokwe on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power."  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Raises Serious Legal Questions: Wydra on Boat Strike

author: Matthew Bristow
description: Donald Trump’s favored candidate, Nasry Asfura, has lost his lead in Honduras’ ongoing presidential vote count, falling behind a rival the US leader attacked as a “borderline communist.”
title: Trump-Backed Candidate Slips Behind Rival in Honduras Vote Count

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins said she is considering pulling food benefits from several Democratic-led states unless they provide more detailed information on recipients of aid.
title: Trump Official Eyes Pulling SNAP Aid From Democratic States

description: Outrage over the catastrophe threatens to revive dissent that Beijing has sought to eradicate.
title: Hong Kong Fire Draws Fury Over Ignored Warnings

description:
Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said he wasn’t watching when a top US admiral ordered a second strike on an alleged drug-running boat on Sept. 2. Hegseth says that commander made the right call. 
“As you can imagine, at the Department of War, we got a lot of things to do, so I didn’t stick around for the hour and two hours, whatever, where all the sensitive site exploitation digitally occurs,” Hegseth said at the White House on Tuesday.
The Trump administration has been criticized after the Washington Post said Hegseth gave an order to kill everyone on the boat. The Post said the second strike was ordered after it was clear there were survivors.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Hegseth Says He Did Not Order Second Deadly Boat Strike

description: Senator Rand Paul, a Republican from Kentucky, says the US attacks on alleged drug boats coming from Venezuela are a "prelude to war." He says Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has to take responsibility for the second strike that was ordered on a boat on Sept. 2. Paul speaks on "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Attacks on Drug Boats Are 'Outrageous,' Says Sen. Rand Paul

author: Emily Birnbaum, Maeve Sheehey
description: A powerful coalition of tech companies backed by the White House’s artificial intelligence chief appears to have failed to persuade lawmakers to use a must-pass defense bill to block state governments from regulating artificial intelligence, a key congressional Republican signaled Tuesday.
title: Tech Industry Drive to Block State AI Laws Hits Wall in Congress

author: Ania Nussbaum, Colum Murphy
description: Emmanuel Macron is flying into another controversy over Taiwan.
title: Xi Courts Macron in Diplomatic Effort to Isolate Japan’s Premier

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: It’s not clear that relaxing the standard will lower costs for consumers.
title: Trump to Roll Back Fuel Economy Rules in Nod to Rising Car Prices

author: Erik Wasson, Caitlin Reilly, Steven T. Dennis
description: Chances are increasing that Obamacare subsidies will expire at the end of the month and trigger a spike in health insurance premiums as a deadlock in Congress deepens on the issue.
title: Obamacare Subsidies Likely to Expire With Congress in Deadlock

description: Bank of America Private Bank Head of Family Office Solutions Elizabeth Thiessen believes that the widespread wealth transfer that is occurring across the US is also affecting family offices, as a majority are beginning to think about a new generation and era of investing with an "increased focus on philanthropy and a definite increase use of technology." She joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break down the evolution of family office investing. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Family Offices Increasingly Looking to Next Generation

description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec discuss Bitcoin's rebound back over $90,000 following a prolonged selloff. Bloomberg's Monique Mulima joins the show to break it down. Also on today's show, AGI at Amazon Senior Vice President and Head Scientist Rohit Prasad sits down with 'Bloomberg Tech' co-host Ed Ludlow to discuss the rollout of Amazon's Nova Forge generative AI model, and Bank of America Private Bank Head of Family Office Solutions Elizabeth Thiessen discusses the evolution of family office investing. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Bitcoin Rallies Back Above 90k | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 12/2/2025

description: Eli Weinstein stole millions of dollars from investors during Covid after Donald Trump commuted his sentence for an earlier conviction. Now Weinstein is said to be planning to ask for clemency again. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: The High Price of Clemency

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said he spoke with his Brazilian counterpart, Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, about sanctions the US imposed on officials from the South American country, a signal that relations between the two nations continue to improve.
title: Trump Says Brazil’s Lula Discussed Sanctions, Trade in Call

description: Amazon is introducing updates to its main line of AI models, including Nova Forge, a generative AI model designed to let sophisticated users grab versions of Amazon’s Nova models and customize them with their own data. AGI at Amazon Senior Vice President & Head Scientist Rohit Prasad joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break down whats's next for Amazon's line of AI products. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: AWS Introduces Amazon Nova Forge Generative AI Model

author: Yang Yang, Naomi Ng, K Oanh Ha
description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, we look at how the deadliest Hong Kong fire in decades united a city in grief and pierced the fragile political calm.
title: Hong Kong's Deadly Fire Triggers Rare Public Outrage

author: Josh Wingrove
description: Donald Trump hailed a gift from Michael and Susan Dell to jumpstart investment accounts for American children, expanding a signature initiative from the president’s tax law that has drawn support from corporate and financial leaders.
title: Trump Hails $6 Billion Dell Gift to Boost Accounts for Children

author: Mario Parker
description: The Pentagon defended a series of missile strikes in the Caribbean Sea, lambasted Democrats and criticized traditional news organizations in a press briefing where attendance was limited to media that have agreed to limits on the scope of their reporting.
title: Pentagon Blasts ‘Legacy Media’ at Briefing for New Press Corps

description: Former SEC chair Gary Gensler said that investors should be aware of the risks of investing in a 'speculative, volatile' asset like crypto even as it becomes more accepted in the mainstream and by Trump White House. He also talks about the recent trading disruptions at the Chicago Mercantile Exchange.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Gensler Says Bitcoin Remains 'Speculative, Volatile'

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu discusses the latest developments from DC. On today's show, Council on Foreign Relations Senior Fellow Lianna Fix, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis, Harvard Kennedy School's Ash Center Visiting Democracy Fellow Jeanne Sheehan Zaino, Republican Congressman Carlos Gimenez of Florida and former States Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Gary Gensler. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Putin Meets With Witkoff, Kushner | Balance of Power: Early Edition 12/2/2025

description: Liana Fix, senior fellow for Europe at the Council on Foreign Relations, said Russia's goal in negotiating with the US is emerge with control over a weakened Ukraine that's not allied with western nations (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Witkoff 'Lacks Expertise' on Russian Deception, Says Liana Fix

description:
President Donald Trump suggested the Pentagon will soon start targeting drug cartels with strikes on land in Venezuela and beyond, after a campaign that has mainly focused on alleged trafficking vessels in the Caribbean and eastern Pacific Ocean. 
“We’re going to start doing those strikes on land, you know, the land is much easier, it’s much easier, and we know the routes they take,” Trump said on Tuesday at the White House, adding that the US would start land strikes “very soon.”  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Says Will Attack Drug Traffickers on Land If Needed (Q&A)

author: Katarina Hoije
description: Guinea-Bissau’s electoral commission is unable to announce the results of last month’s presidential elections after a raid on its headquarters left electoral equipment destroyed and ballot sheets missing.
title: No Vote Results in Guinea-Bissau as Equipment Ruined After Raid

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: US strikes on alleged drug-cartel boats in the Caribbean Sea and eastern Pacific Ocean under President Donald Trump represent a sharp departure from traditional US counter-narcotics efforts. Unlike earlier maritime interdictions led mainly by the Coast Guard and other law enforcement agencies, these missions have taken the form of military airstrikes.
title: Are Trump’s Boat Strikes Legal?

author: Edward Ludlow, Loren Grush
description: President Donald Trump’s pick to lead NASA, billionaire SpaceX astronaut Jared Isaacman, will warn lawmakers during a Senate confirmation hearing on Wednesday that falling behind in the space race against China could have grave consequences for the United States.
title: NASA Nominee Warns US Dominance at Risk in Space Race With China

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump suggested the Pentagon will soon start targeting drug cartels with strikes on land in Venezuela and beyond, after a campaign that has mainly focused on alleged trafficking vessels in the Caribbean and eastern Pacific Ocean.
title: Trump Said US Will ‘Soon’ Do Land Strikes on Drug Traffickers

author: Tooba Khan
description: Pakistan’s jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan is in good health after concerns mounted since nobody met him for more than three weeks, according to his sister.
title: Imran Khan In Good Health After Concerns Mounted for Weeks

author: Zoe Tillman, Myles Miller, Jimmy Jenkins
description: Federal prosecutors charged a man suspected of shooting two National Guard members — one of whom later died — with first-degree murder and assault with intent to kill.
title: Murder Charge Filed Against Afghan in National Guard Shooting

author: Roxana Tiron, Jamie Tarabay
description: Key US lawmakers will question Admiral Frank Bradley this week on his role in ordering a second strike against a suspected drug-trafficking boat in the Caribbean Sea, reportedly to kill survivors seen clinging to the wreckage of their boat.
title: Admiral at Center of Venezuela Boat Strikes to Brief Congress

author: Michelle Kaske
description: The Trump administration has started discussions with New York officials on whether the Hudson River tunnel and Second Avenue Subway projects comply with new rules on diversity, fueling hope the US Department of Transportation will free up $18 billion in funding tied to developments in the area.
title: NY, Trump Administration in Talks on Resuming Paused Transit Funds

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said the federal government would seek to “rebuild” Washington Dulles International Airport after a series of crashes involving vehicles that transport passengers from the gates to the main terminal.
title: Trump Plans Dulles Airport ‘Rebuild’ After People Mover Crashes

description: "We've stopped inflation in its tracks and there is still more to do," President Donald Trump says. Speaking during a Cabinet meeting at the White House, Trump also says he plans to announce his selection to lead the Federal Reserve in early 2026. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Says He’ll Probably Announce New Fed Chair ‘Early Next Year’

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Myles Miller
description: The Trump administration is expected to expand its travel ban to include around 30 countries, a bid to more aggressively curtail migration to the US following last week’s shooting of two National Guard members in Washington.
title: Trump to Expand Travel Ban to Around 30 Countries After Shooting

author: Alex Wickham, Lucy White
description: The UK government further delayed a decision on whether to approve China’s proposed new embassy until January, when Prime Minister Keir Starmer is expected to visit Beijing.
title: UK Further Delays China Embassy Decision Until January

author: Josh Wingrove, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said he plans to announce his selection to lead the Federal Reserve in early 2026, fueling further speculation about the next leader of the US central bank.
title: Trump Says He’ll Announce New Fed Chair ‘Early Next Year’

author: Mirette Magdy
description: Saudi Arabia plans to stick to elevated spending and active borrowing to keep economic diversification at the forefront of the kingdom’s agenda — despite the challenge of lower oil prices.
title: Saudis Won’t Let Low Oil Distract From Spending, Borrowing Plans

description: Michael and Susan Dell are giving $6.25 billion to help children invest in their future. The money will be used to fund the Invest America Initiative, better known as "Trump Accounts." Under the program, the government starts investment accounts for kids with $1,000. The Dells' gift will fund accounts for children who aren't eligible for the government money. Bloomberg's Michael Shepard reports.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Dell Helps Fund Trump Accounts With $6.25 Billion Gift

author: Gabrielle Coppola, David Welch, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The Trump administration is poised to announce new fuel efficiency standards for automobiles in a bid to undo requirements it has assailed for driving up the cost of new cars, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump to Ease Mileage Rules in Bid to Curb Rising Car Prices

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: Canada will raise concerns about NATO’s approach to Arctic threats at a meeting in Brussels on Wednesday, Foreign Minister Anita Anand said.
title: Canada Will Press NATO Allies to Focus More on Arctic Threats

author: Marcelo Rochabrun
description: At least three shots were fired at Peruvian presidential candidate Rafael Belaunde on Tuesday in a beach town near Lima.
title: Peru Candidate Belaunde Uninjured After Shots Fired at His Car

author: Arne Delfs, Michael Nienaber
description: A test vote by lawmakers in Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s conservative caucus suggested his ruling coalition may struggle to get a disputed bill overhauling Germany’s state pension system approved in parliament this week.
title: Merz’s German Pension Reform in Doubt After Caucus Test Vote

author: Monique Mulima
description: The sharp pullback in Bitcoin prices over the past month is making an impact on speculative corners of the cryptocurrency market.
title: Crypto Firm Tied to Trumps Sees Share Price Halve in 30 Minutes

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump delivered on his promise to pardon former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernandez, freeing the onetime leader from US prison where he was serving a 45-year sentence for drug trafficking.
title: Trump Pardons Ex-Honduras Leader Convicted of Drug Trafficking

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: Vladimir Putin warned that Russia may consider striking the ships of countries supporting Ukraine if a surge in attacks on Moscow’s tanker fleet continues, according to local media reports.
title: Putin Warns of Possible Strikes on Ukraine Allies’ Ships

author: Lydia Beyoud
description: The nation’s top securities regulator is planning to make it easier for small companies to go public by cutting mandatory disclosures and scaling back requirements based on the size of the firm.
title: SEC Chief Wants to Boost IPOs by Easing Rules for Small Firms

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: US negotiations with Russia over a plan to end its war in Ukraine will not make unilateral decisions about NATO’s future, Secretary General Mark Rutte said.
title: US Peace Talks With Russia Will Not Exclude NATO, Rutte Says

description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras (AP) — Former Honduras President Juan Orlando Hernández, sentenced last year to 45 years in prison for his role in helping drug traffickers move hundreds of tons of cocaine to the United States, was released from prison following a pardon from President Donald Trump, his wife announced Tuesday.
title: Honduran Ex-President Released From US Prison After Trump Pardon

author: Philip Aldrick
description: Britain’s fiscal watchdog complained to senior Treasury officials over leaks to media about the state of the economy in the build up to last week’s budget.
title: UK’s Troubled OBR Complained to Treasury About Budget Leaks

author: Lucca de Paoli
description: Juries will be scrapped in England and Wales for a range of criminal trials, including the most complex financial crime, in the biggest shake-up of the country’s justice system in decades.
title: Jury Trials to Be Scrapped in England for Complex Financial Crimes

author: Samuel Stolton
description: Federica Mogherini, the former head of the European Union’s diplomatic arm, as well as a top EU official were both detained by Belgian police following raids into suspected fraud.
title: EU’s Former Top Diplomat, Official Arrested in Fraud Probe

author: Julian Lee
description: The amount of Russian crude on tankers rose by more than 20% since the end of August
title: Russia's Surging Oil Exports Stuck at Sea as Curbs Slow Delivery

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland will tighten rules around foreign investment as a shifting geopolitical backdrop pushes countries to take measures to protect domestic companies and industries.
title: Switzerland to Tighten Rules on Some Foreign Investments

author: Ewa Krukowska
description: The European Union is closing in on a deal to phase out Russian fossil fuels, a move that will embed into law the end of the bloc’s reliance on its former top energy supplier.
title: Europe Is Nearing Deal to End Russian Fossil Fuels Imports

author: Marton Kasnyik
description: Hungary has raised its request for European Union defense funds to €17.4 billion ($20.2 billion), money the government says will help upgrade its military and cut the highest financing cost in the bloc.
title: Hungary Requests More Than $20 Billion in EU Defense Funds

author: Biz Carson, Tom Maloney
description: In an unprecedented philanthropic gift, Michael and Susan Dell will give 25 million American children $250 each to jumpstart an investment account for their futures.
title: Michael Dell Gives $6.25 Billion to Launch ‘Trump Accounts’ for 25 Million Kids

author: David Herbling
description: Soldiers from the British Army allegedly committed crimes including rape, sexual assault and murder while training in Kenya, according to a parliamentary probe in the East African nation.
title: Kenyan Lawmakers Accuse British Army of Murder, Sexual Assault

author: Slav Okov
description: Bulgarian police detained 71 people overnight after brief but violent clashes following the country’s biggest protests in more than a decade.
title: Bulgarian Police Detained 71 People After Monday Rally Clashes

author: William Horobin
description: France’s National Assembly is starting a second reading of the 2026 social security budget bill on Tuesday in a crucial test of Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu’s plan to shepherd contested financial legislation through a divided parliament.
title: French Premier’s Budget Push Faces Key Stretch Ahead of Vote

author: Andrew Rosati, Cristiane Lucchesi
description: Days before police descended on his high-flying investment firm Reag Investimentos SA, João Carlos Mansur was boasting on TV. “The truth is, we look for opportunity at all times,” the company’s founder and the face behind its rocketing success said in an August interview.
title: Asset Manager Swept Up in Gang Probe Jolts Brazil’s Wall Street

author: Ethan Bronner
description: Trump has called for the prime minister to be exonerated from bribery and fraud charges.
title: Israeli Rifts Reopened by Netanyahu Graft-Pardon Bid

author: Ditas B Lopez, Manolo Serapio Jr
description: The Philippines is planning to raise its international bond sales by over 60% next year, as the government seeks to finance an economy stunted by a graft scandal.
title: Philippines to Bump Up Global Bond Supply as Graft Hits Economy

author: Alex Vasquez
description: Mexico’s political risk has crept up to levels seen in Peru, as Mexicans voice mounting frustration over cartel-fueled crime, corruption and a stagnant economy.
title: Mexico Political Risk Hits Peru Level as Sheinbaum Support Sags

author: Manuela Tobias
description: Argentine President Javier Milei’s popularity picked up after his party’s landslide victory in midterm elections as both voter perceptions of his administration and economic expectations improved.
title: Milei’s Approval Rises After Victory in Argentine Midterm Vote

author: Oscar Medina
description: Colombia President Gustavo Petro’s popularity waned in November despite strong economic growth, as a pair of major scandals involving the armed forces and his former finance minister rocked the nation.
title: Petro’s Approval Ebbs Even as Colombia Economy Gains Steam

author: Ott Ummelas, Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: Norway’s ruling Labor Party is signaling no concessions on key demands by two smaller partners as talks continue on next year’s budget with an aim to avert a cabinet crisis.
title: Norway’s Labor, Partners Resume Talks to Break Budget Deadlock

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: The European defense sector grew by 13.8% in 2024 from the previous year to generate €183.4 billion ($213 billion) in turnover, according to a report published Tuesday by the Aerospace, Security and Defense Industries Association of Europe.
title: Europe’s Defense Industry Grew by Nearly 14% in 2024

author: Martin Ritchie
description: At least three Chinese rare-earth magnet producers have been granted export licenses that will enable them to accelerate shipments following a trade truce between the US and China, Reuters reported, citing an unnamed source familiar with the matter.
title: China Rare-Earth Firms Get Simpler Export Licenses, Reuters Says

author: Anthony Halpin, Olesia Safronova
description: US envoy Steve Witkoff is traveling to Moscow to meet with President Vladimir Putin, who claimed a key Ukrainian city had fallen to Russia on the eve of the talks about a potential peace plan to end his war.
title: US Envoy Heads to Russia as Putin Claims Key Ukrainian City Fell

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: A coalition of Japanese lawmakers promoting friendship with China met with Chinese Ambassador to Japan Wu Jianghao in Tokyo according to local media, signaling efforts to ease tensions while the two nations also sparred over disputed islands.
title: Japan Lawmakers Meet Chinese Envoy Amid Spat, Reports Say

author: Paul Richardson
description: Nigeria’s defense minister quit as President Bola Tinubu prepares to unveil a plan to deal with a security emergency in the West African nation.
title: Defense Minister Quits as Nigeria Grapples With Security Crisis

author: Ott Tammik
description: From a control tower overlooking a muddy field in central Estonia, Maido Ruusmann and a pair of local investors watched as a meter-long spy drone was launched into the air using a giant elastic band. It climbed to a height of a kilometer and traced circles in the sky, sending data and images back to about a dozen people huddled around monitors on the ground below.
title: Estonia Is Writing Its Own Playbook to Build a Defense Industry

author: John Bowker
description: A leading Iranian rights activist and Nobel laureate said state suppression in the Islamic Republic is getting worse as the country faces multiple crises, including regional isolation and a deteriorating economy.
title: Nobel Laureate Says Iran Using Execution as ‘Tool of Repression’

author: Laura Alviz, Jenny Leonard
description: As Europe embarks on a historic rearming effort, its defense companies are scrambling for a vital component in high-tech weapons: rare earth minerals, which more nimble US rivals are scooping up.
title: US Firms Are Snapping Up the Rare Earths Europe Needs to Rearm

author: Anisah Shukry
description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said he expects the country’s debt pressures to ease beginning end-2028, driven by the government’s efforts to reduce its fiscal deficit.
title: Malaysia PM Anwar Expects Debt Pressure to Ease From End-2028

author: Yian Lee, Stephen Engle
description: The dispute between China and Japan could drag on for a year, Taiwanese Foreign Minister Lin Chia-lung said, adding Taipei hopes the two sides can find a way to ease tensions.
title: China-Japan Clash May Persist for a Year, Taiwan Minister Warns

author: Maggie Eastland, Nick Turner
description: The US Commerce Department has agreed to invest as much as $150 million in xLight Inc., a chip technology startup tied to former Intel Corp. Chief Executive Officer Pat Gelsinger.
title: Commerce Department to Back Chip Startup From Former Intel CEO

author: Toru Fujioka, Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s finance and economic ministers didn’t indicate any objections a day after Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda delivered the clearest hint yet pointing to the possibility of an interest rate increase this month.
title: Japanese Ministers Refrain From Pushback After BOJ’s Hike Signal

author: Erica Yokoyama, Takashi Umekawa
description: Japan launched its own version of the Department of Government Efficiency with an inaugural meeting setting out plans to identify and weed out ineffective tax measures and subsidies.
title: Japan’s DOGE ‘Essential’ for Keeping Market Trust, Katayama Says

author: Jef Feeley
description: The Trump administration urged the US Supreme Court to take up Bayer AG’s appeal targeting thousands of lawsuits blaming its top-selling Roundup weedkiller for causing cancer.
title: Trump Official Urges Supreme Court to Take Bayer Roundup Appeal
